meanings.definition: Increase the power or efficiency of (something) by raising its rating or level.
meanings.sent1: She uprates her computer by adding more memory.
meanings.sent2: The company uprates the production line to meet demand.
meanings.sent3: He uprates his bicycle with a new, faster gear.
meanings.sent4: The chef uprates the flavor of the dish with a pinch of salt.
meanings.sent5: The sun uprates the beauty of the flowers in the garden.

meanings.definition: To raise the rate or amount of something.
meanings.sent1: The bank uprates the interest on savings accounts.
meanings.sent2: The government uprates the minimum wage for workers.
meanings.sent3: She uprates the volume on the radio to hear her favorite song better.
meanings.sent4: The teacher uprates the difficulty of the quiz to challenge the students.
meanings.sent5: The rain uprates the growth of the plants in the garden.
